byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Brussels, and Milan Schreuer from Paris.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and MILAN SCHREUER

abstract: Authorities investigating Brussels attack find video footage of Belgian nuclear facility official in apartment of Islamic State militant suspected of link to Paris attack; discovery raises fear terrorists are seeking to attack, infiltrate or sabotage nuclear installations or obtain nuclear or radioactive material; news is troubling in country with history of security lapses at its nuclear installations and deeply rooted terrorist network.
lead_paragraph: Belgian authorities fear that Islamic State militants may try to attack, infiltrate or sabotage nuclear plants or obtain nuclear or radioactive material.

headline.main: Belgium Fears Nuclear Plants Are Vulnerable
headline.print_headline: Belgium Fears Nuclear Plants Are Vulnerable

snippet: Belgian authorities fear that Islamic State militants may try to attack, infiltrate or sabotage nuclear plants or obtain nuclear or radioactive material.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
